title: How to add an event on someone else's Google Calendar - Quora

response.answer_text: Ask them to share their calendar to you, with edit capability. Or, publish your event, and spread that link so they can add it themselves. Add a Google calendar to your website On a computer, open Google Calendar. You can only make changes to your calendar visibility from a computer, not the mobile app.On a public calendar, create or edit an event.Click More actions Publish eventIn the "Publish event" window, copy the link displayed.Send this link.
Simply sync your calendar to theirs and add an event. It will automatically show up on theirs as well! I hope this answer helps. Thanks for your question!

If you create a Google calendar event and edit the event to add guests, and IF those guests have Gmail email addresses AND use Google calendar themselves, the event will automatically show up on their calendar. Otherwise it won't.
response.upvotes: Answer requested by Ike Averee and Adele Perriello
